fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Culture, Education and training, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Communication
head_office_address: EBLT c/o Mercator Kennissintrum c/o Fryske Akademy
eu_initiatives: Multilingualism, culture, education (including lifelong learning), Intergroup Minorities, European Capitals of Culture, European Civil Initiatives.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: EBLT is a member of the Network to Promote Linguistic Diversity (NPLD), www.npld.eu
goals__remit:
The goal of EBLT is to safeguard, protect and promote all minority languages spoken in the Kingdom of the Netherlands. At present EBLT represents the following language communities: Frisian, Bildts, Low Saxon (Nedersaksisch), Papiamentu and Limburgish.  
 
In order to that EBLT also collaborates with minority language communities in other member states of the EU and their networks, such as FUEN and NPLD.
inter_groups: Intergroup for Traditional Minorities, National Communities and Languages
relevant_communication:
Conference about the position of Low Saxon/Niederdeutsch in the EP on 28.9.2016.  
 
Every year EBLT organizes an activity in the framework of the European Day of Languages in September. 
 
EBLT is also involved in the European Civil Initiative Minority SafePack Initiative.
